message: لو هاعمل Portal كبير زى سوق او جوميا مثلا عن الE-Commerce هل استخدم frame work زى Magento مثلا ولا اعمل الframe work الخاص بالمشروع from scratch عشان اتحكم فى كل حاجة?

data.message: على حسب الى هيعملك الشغل
على حسب كلمة "كبير" دي معناها ايه , ,ديما هقولك ابدا بفريم وورك وادخ لالسوق بعد كده لو الموضوع ماشي هتقدر تعمل اي حاجه انت عايزها :)
wordpress woocommerce perfect for start magento plugins and themes is so expensive + the community support for woocommerce is better (don't ever invent the wheel)
Magento

My humble opinion. Start with the simplest solution with shortest time to market so in this case magento or even Wordpress with woocommerce. If you see the business is booming then do whatever you want with it next.
ابدأ ب woocommarce  ومتقربش من Magento في البدايه هتصرف كتتير وهضيع علي وقت كتتير ومهواش الي هيكون السبب انك يكون عندك عملاء اكبر ولا هيفيد العميل في حاجه زيادة
موش دي من وجهة نظري القضية الأساسية. القضية الأساسية في مشروع  زي ده هو التكنولوجي المستخدم في البحث. في هذا السياق ارشح النظر إلى Solr
مش محتاج تعمل حاجة من الصفر لانه مش هيبقي مفيد زي الفريم ووك الجاهز ..... لو المشروع كبير استعمل ماجنتو لو متوسط استعمل اوبن كارت  لو صغير استعمل woocommerce
if you're not going to use magento or opencart  use symfony framework

start with an open source project like magneto,,, build an experience... i mean business , market and user feedback experience. and then decide wither to start over again or to continue with some code refactory.
i have consulted companies in this domain and i believe this is the best practice
good luck

NEVER do something from scratch unless you have 1m user per month and you can't satisfy them :)!

Magento is the biggest, but extremely complicated!
For 8+ years I never did use a Framework, now I regret every second. :( I use Laravel Now.
ال Magento مش Framework اساسا ديه Shopping Cart
What about verifying the business model using shopify, if it works then start developing based on your requirements
Mohamed Taha

To get there you will go through very big development process not only from software development side but also and more important from business development side to focus on your core values. So please consider using what makes you get you MVP fast and to the point so you can provide service fast and with low development cost. Once you are authentic about your MVP you can now think big.
What features beyond products catalogue, shopping cart, payment do you need to have? If that is all what you need, there is no need obviously.

Let me put it in another way. List the features the ecommerce solution offers, and list the features that you need. If the ecommerce offers too many features that you won't need, definitely look for a simpler more matching/more flexible solution, otherwise build from scratch.

One mistake I saw people make is, just because they need something with payment, they immediately think they need an ecommerce solution. Payment is just a page on your ecommerce website.

Mohamed Bakry لو احتجت تلعب في اساسه قلي 
http://openshop.io
ده برضو مش وحش OpenCart
لو عندك خطط توسعية يبقى ماجنتو اجبارى

look it depends, depends on many factors

1- your team: regarding magento, it needs developers who have been working with it for long time. 
2- Any e-commerce needs a developer who has already shipped an app with it. Also you've to study well the parts which needs modifications before picking up your tool. (ana lebset kza marra bsbb aktr mn ecommerce m3rofeen).
3- regarding creating your own e-commerce, you have to pickup a framework (no choice or you'll burn up your team and end with a mess). Also take care to choose a framework than had a wide range of developers in Egypt in order to have a smooth and easy hiring process.

last advice: you have to list all the feature in a very details document and mockups for each single feature and page.
PS: building e-commerce takes a lot of time and needs aloooooot of testing.
